revised_title: Retardation Effects on Lattice Vibrations and Optical Waves in Ionic Crystals
tldr: The author presents a symmetric treatment of the interaction between the radiation field and diatomic ionic crystals, showing that the optical waves immediately below the infra-red dispersion frequency are actually the transverse lattice vibrations of long wavelength in the theory of ionic crystals. The study reveals that these waves consist mainly of mechanical vibrational energy rather than radiative energy.
